productDescription: As you can see from my sleek exterior and anti-slip feet, Im one mean bean grinding machine. From coarse to fiiiine, my sharp stainless steel blades have the moves to get your beans in the groove. So prepare to get your perk on.

Doctors say coffee is the most important meal of the day. Ok, we know they mean 'breakfast' but lets be real, if youre reading this, coffee is an essential and possibly life-saving part of your daily routine. But there is no need to fear, as this grinder is built to not let you down.

This grinder sports a 100g (3.5 ounce) capacity with stainless steel blades that feeds on coffee beans. With silicone feet at its base for grip and stabilityplus a sturdy, strong, and stylish rubber coatingit's built to handle the daily grind.

A good coffee rub can really take your grilling to the next level. It has a dark, earthy flavor with a nice balance of garlic and onion. Without being overly salty or sweet, its the perfect seasoning and also super easy to make! All you gotta do is combine the ingredients below in a large bowl and mix em up. Then, store your rub in a seal container and use it on ribs, burgers, chicken, or any meat you want to take up a notch. (Note: Grinder should be used for beans Only - use pre-ground spices for recipe.) Heres what you need:

This grinder is designed to make sure your coffee is what wakes you up - not excess noise. This grinder runs quietly and features a pulse mode for a more consistent grind. It's not only easy on your ears, it's easy cleaning too. Packaged with the grinder is an easy to use, effective, cleaning brush. Just place the grinder under running water and scrub with the brush to get a clean machine in seconds!

A good grinder and fresh beans are your tag-team for optimal coffee flavor. Here are some tips to ensure your beans are as fresh as possible before they get their grind on. Unlike your greatest enemies (Monday, and that one coworker) your beans greatest foes are air, moisture, heat, and light. So its important to store them in an opaque, airtight container to keep air and light out. Store the beans in a dark and chilled location and they'll stay cool, calm, and collected.

Coffee grounds are only as good as the way they're brewed. Not only is this grinder powerful, sturdy, and efficient, but its also very popular. Its electric personality gets along very well with our The Pick-Up Artist Single Cup Coffee Maker, Carafe Commander Coffee Carafe, and the But First, Espresso Maker. They make a great squad to keep you caffeinated. Think the A-Team, but for coffee consumption.

reviews.reviewText: The diameter of the grinding cup is quite a bit larger than the blade, which results in some of the beans "flying in formation" around the outside and not getting ground properly. Even with stopping, shaking, and restarting, and grinding for 30 seconds, some beans are powdered and some merely cut in half. Previous Krups grinder took 1/3 the time and gave far more even results. Difference? Oval-shaped, smaller grind cup mixes beans better, forcing different beans past the blade each revolution. Buy the Krups F203 instead.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick and easy fix to my coffee bean conundrum
reviews.reviewText: What do you do when you buy whole beans at the warehouse store and forget to grind them before you go? You buy Amazon in a coffee grinder! This gadget is small enough to stow easily in a cabinet without being a big deal. It gets the job done quickly and easily (just ask my 8 year old who decided to experiment with grinding a bunch of beans while I was trying to brew a cup of coffee). Clean up is straightforward with a moist cloth. The only thing about cleanup is that the center white piece holds bits of coffee on the wings.

Very large for a coffee grinder. Takes up a lot of counter space.
Cumbersome to hold. (I have average sized, female hands) I can barely get a grip on it with one hand. Which, makes it difficult to hold with 1 hand & tip to scoop out & measure the ground coffee.
Flimsy construction. The base, red portion is nicely made but the top is very fragile. Upon taking it out of the box, the push button & spring fell right off. I can't imagine that it will hold up to daily use for very long.
It grinds the coffee but I don't feel that it is very powerful for it's size & it seems to take a longer time to get a medium grind. There is a warning label on the lid stating not to run it for more than 50 seconds at a time & to let the motor rest between uses. Not Impressed with that. Also, I don't feel this grinder would be able to handle grinding any spices, etc. I don't want to have to buy a 2nd grinder/appliance to do a job that the 1st one should already do.
Positives-
The grinder is quiet.
The cord winds up nicely in the base.
Overall, I'm returning it for another option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes a MEAN Cup of Joe
reviews.reviewText: Oh man, I have wanted a decent coffee grinder forever because I am a coffee fanatic and LOVE fresh coffee! I prefer buying the beans and grinding them myself but my grinder broke and I've been on the hunt for a new one ever since. Good thing I ran across this on Amazon and decided to give it a try because it is PERFECT for me! It makes my coffee so much more flavorful and aromatic when the beans are ground fresh and then used for coffee. This is a daily staple in my household because I drink coffee every day, Luckily this will grind enough for either just me, or a full pot of coffee! If you love a good cup of joe as much as I do, this is a great product to own!

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon was great! It was here in one day
reviews.reviewText:
Amazon was great! It was here in one day. Down side is one of the rubber nubs on the bottom is missing so it titters on the counter, it is really big compared to my Mr Coffee grinder. Does not seem to grind as fine as the other one did for espresso. Would send it back but to much hassle living in the country. Stuck with it!
This is an update after a week of using, I grind coffee for espresso in the morning, this grinder will not grind the bean fine enough so that it stays in the holder. It sticks to the bottom of the screen even after compressing the grounds into the holder, this may work for herbs or spices but do not buy it if you plan on a good cup of espresso.

reviews.reviewTitle: This one is great. Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I accidently dropped my older coffee grinder and it broke so I was quickly looking for a replacement. This one is great. Easy to use, no confusion on how to operate it. My husband uses a french press which requires fine ground beans, and this does it easily. And it comes with a small cleaning brush so it makes it really easy to clean out between uses and coffee bean types. It's not a big grinder so it fits right in the cupboard along side the french press. Really happy with this grinder :)

This is a lovely little grinder, very easy to operate and hold. Minus stars for two reasons, one, it takes forever to grind. I had an old grinder maybe 15-20 years old and it was so fast and made a very fine grind (if thats what you wanted) very quickly, this one goes on quite a while I have to stop the pulse button which says not to hold it down for more then a minute or it will overheat. It takes more then a minute to get a nice grind. Its much quieter then my old one which is nice, but takes a lot more time. The 2nd problem is if you want to make espresso, you can not get a fine enough grind on this no matter how long you grind. It will grind beans, and for the cost, its nice.

Bought this based on positive reviews. No matter how long I grind/pulse/shake and how much or little coffee beans I use, I can't get the level of fineness that I could with my deceased Mr. Coffee grinder. Will likely toss it.

I know this is a relatively inexpensive product, but DO NOT waste your money and find an alternative instead. I would honestly give this a zero star review if I could - very frustrating and unsafe experience.

The seller claims this product is "large capacity", "safe", and "hassle free". It is none of these things. In particular, it is unsafe.

First off, the product broke after actually a week of use as instructed (7 days). Now, the only way to turn the grinder on is to plug it in, however, the blades immediately start to run upon plugging in and sound like a forge or a dental drill - not what your coffee grinder should sound like - something has broken. Now there is no safe way to insert the beans without risk of a finger wound.

I would love my money back. While this product didn't "break the bank", the principle that the seller could sell consumers something that breaks in a week and presents a serious danger (in other words, engaging in a scheme) is enough to make me not want to support the product. I would not recommend this to anyone.

I grind dried rosehips in this. If you have dealt with rosehips, especially dried, then you know they are as hard as rocks. So far the week I have used it it hasn't given out yet. It grinds the rosehips to a nice dust I use for a tincture for my horses. The only reason it got 4 stars instead of five was because the button has to be held down. I wish I could just press it and walk away since rosehips can take a while. Also the wording on the side of the box was very suggestive. I'm sure the makers thought it was clever but not acceptable in a Christian home with little kids, so I quickly threw away the box. But for the price it is a handy grinder. Not many coffee grinders can handle rosehips so I was impressed with this one

This is one powerful grinder! Both my husband and I were impressed by how easily and Quietly this ground coffee beans. No joke, whole beans and no crunchy grinding sound. Just a soft whirr for a couple seconds was enough to get the beans fine enough for coffee. The Vremi Blade Coffee Grinder ground the beans evenly too which is very important. It is so irrigating when grinders I have owned in the past have ground some beans too fine and some too chunky in the same batch. Not the Vremi Coffee grinder. Consistent grind, quiet, quick and easy to clean. I am happy to say I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: My new best friend in all cooking prep...not just for coffee beans
reviews.reviewText: I have a tiny kitchen but I love gadgets and coffee (not necessarily in that order. So I splurged for this sucker. I use it to chop my carrots and celery but NOT onions or garlic. Learned that one on it's predecessor. It makes a pretty good juicer too for the lime juice in the guacamole. Oh, and yes, it will medium, moderately and finely grind your coffee beans. Not an adjustment it offers, you just have to remember to stop depending on your brewer. I have an off brand (tiny) k-cup brewer so the finer the better for me. This thing is spoiling me for pre-filled k-cups.

reviews.reviewTitle: The worst grinder on the planet.
reviews.reviewText: You have got to be kidding with this piece of garbage. It's as big as a pumpkin so good luck holding it, and I have big man hands. It won't grind anything over a tablespoon at a time and even as it does, it doesn't have the ability to actually grind the beans, it mashes them, leaving a thick silt on the insides of the grinder while the remainder stays too course to brew. This has to be either a joke or a bell pepper dicer, but this is not a coffee grinder. This is a waste if time, money and resources. I may as well have put my beans in a bag and smashed them with a hammer... Thanks

Grinder is as cheaply made as the sexy box. Spring on lid was detached when opened. Cord does not fit anywhere so the item awkwardly tips over and the General construction is cheap. Color is nice. The box! What the heck is this monstrousity. Each side has a sexy slogan - twerk and perk, shake your beans- get your beans in the groove, its fiiiiine, bump and grind, grind with care - lets get it on. So gross. Sending it back - mostly annoyed that this company thinks I need sexy to sell me a coffee grinder.

Great little grinder for the money BUT does not grind coffee beans to fine grind or thoroughly . Always has large chunks that just dont totally grind So if you need fine grounds maybe not quite strong enough.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder! We love whole beans but have never ...
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder! We love whole beans but have never been thrilled with our old grinder. It ground things uneven and left bean chunks but not this beauty. It gives you nice smooth grinds. It's so much more quite than our other one too and has a nice grip. I don't leave things out on my counter because I hate clutter but one could very easy leave this out and it wouldn't be an eye sore. For 14.99 you can't beat it!

It takes a couple of times to get the timing right, but it is pretty easy. It is also easy to clean and doesn't take up much space in the cabinet - although it is nice enough looking to put out on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool design. Very simple. But not for espresso lovers.
reviews.reviewText: Although this grinder is not designed to make espresso grinds, it's possible to make it after you filter out the coarse grinds and re grinding the beans. Although this takes 5 minutes you will still get roughl espresso like fine grinds. But the coffee grinder is easy to clean and easy to use. There is no speed set up for the blades but with the price this is an average product for drip coffee and morning coffee enthusiast.

reviews.reviewTitle: this grinder has a great look and feel to it
reviews.reviewText: this grinder has a great look and feel to it. I also like how the bottom is raised enough for the cord to fit underneath around the entire base of the grinder. much more convenient than a common design of one slot in the side of the base. the main draw back to this grinder is that it doesn't grind the coffee as well as other grinders I've had. there is always seems to be a fair amount of large pieces of coffee beans that don't get ground when the rest of the coffee is all finely ground. its an ok grinder it just doesn't grind coffee as well as other inexpensive grinders I've used.

reviews.reviewTitle: We used this and our experience was wonderful! It was very easy to use and super ...

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not grind finely, as stated.
reviews.reviewText: This item, contrary to its description, does not grind coffee beans to the powdery size required to make espresso. I ground up to 4+ minutes (in 20 second bursts), even though the motor heated up enough to flavor the grounds, but never could reach a fine enough particle size. The espresso tasted watery and terrible. This unit sounds tinny. The blade is flimsy. The unit is top-heavy and wants to tip over, esp. since the cord will not stay in the cut-out on the bottom of the unit when grinding. I was disappointed enough to return it and order the Krups unit instead, though it was an extra $12 or so. I had an older Krups for years and it really worked well. I'm sorry I ever gave it away! Grind is nearly everything when making espresso. I had ordered this unit to allow me to make espresso while my expensive espresso machine ( w/ grinder) was being serviced. The new Krups ground my beans to powdery in 30 seconds!
Its perfect. Small in size and simple to use. Great little grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Attractive enough to leave next to your coffeemaker; portable for travel
reviews.reviewText:
Using the grinder is easy. Just add fresh coffee beans, replace the cover (which locks on for safety) and press the pulse-operation button. The durable, double stainless-steel blade grind the beans to the right consistency for you based on how long you let it run.
The blade revolves to about 1/8th of an inch from the side wall, so grind for about 5 to 10 seconds, stop and remove the cover, check the consistency and push any partly-ground beans back toward the center with the included brush, replace the cover, grind for a few more seconds, check again. After a few uses, youll know how much grinding time is right for the amount of beans you added to produce your brew. DO NOT PUT YOUR FINGERS INSIDE THE GRINDING CUP AS THE BLADE IS VERY SHARP!
There is a rubber grip exterior and non-slip feet along with cord storage for safety and neatness on your countertop.
Hand wash only! There is no disassembly; use the mini cleaning brush to get in and around the very sharp grinding blade.
The Vremi Blade Coffee Grinder produces an even grind for the smooth brewing strength you want every time. Even better, this is small enough that I tuck it into my suitcase and take it with me along with my preferred coffee beans when Im on a business or vacation trip.

First, what I like:

IT'S QUIET. In comparison to another coffee grinder I have used, this is much quieter. It's more of a gentle "burr" noise than like a grinding screech like my last one (my last sounded like I was actually listening to the wailing cry of a coffee bean being ground).

DURABLE: Why do I know this? Because I dropped the lid once! Nothing broke really except the button you use to press down broke off but it was easily fixable. Unfortunately I had to clean up coffee grounds I dropped to the floor, but oh well.

Straight forward: No fancy buttons, nothing. I like that. I just want the beans ground, it's a pretty basic simple experience.

The downside?

It's ever so mildly awkward getting the grounds out because that little cup, if you tip in just the right way, will split out the ground coffee. So that's an art I need to master. The other down side is if coffee gets stuck I actually have to use my finger to kind unlodge the coffee grounds from around the edge. Painless bad thing though I guess.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Coffee Grinder with the Exception of Consistency
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder is small enough it can easily sit on the counter next to the coffee maker but it will still grind enough beans for a whole pot of coffee. There really isn't anything difficult to use this product. It's efficient and does exactly what it was made for. It is significantly less noisy than any grinder I've used. The instructions say the coffee grounds will be ready in 15 seconds. I've found I needed to go about twice the amount of time to actually get the right consistency. However, I noticed the grounds weren't even. Some parts were extremely fine and others were really coarse. There were a couple full beans left as well. For the price, size and ease I would definitely recommend the Vremi Coffee Grinder. I am worried about the consistency problem but I think from now on I will just grind the beans for longer and hope that fixes the issue. If you like your coffee weak and you're worried about it being too strong, then I would suggest looking for a coffee grinder that will be more consistent.

I received this product from Vremi via Review Directory in exchange for an honest review. This in no way, influenced my opinion.

From my FB group the recommendations are bread or rice (rice last as it can dull the blades). The video I am powdering Junk from a batch of tomato soup, Tomato peels and seeds. When running this is surprisingly quiet. It turned the junk into a very aromatic powder in no time.

reviews.reviewTitle: -Chamber is pretty large. You can fit a good amount of ...
reviews.reviewText:
Grinds beans really well for a $15 coffee grinder. I've used friends' machines in the past and they weren't as effective as this device.

PROS:
-Chamber is pretty large. You can fit a good amount of beans and you can fill it up pretty high and still get a great grind.
-Chamber is designed with no nooks or crannies to allow grounds to fall down and not get stuck. I've used grinders in the past that overlooked this obvious fact and this one has a clean, intelligent design on the chamber itself.
-Operation is easy, device is stable and button is large and "depressable" with one finger; whole operation takes 30-90 seconds for complete grind, and one hand.

NEUTRAL (I don't mind these things, but some might):
-No timer or automation, so if you want espresso, it'll take a good 60 seconds to powder the coffee, and you'll have to hold the button down the whole time.
-For a better quality grind, I'd recommend shaking the grinder from side to side and rotating it to add some mixing action in the chamber. This cuts down on grind time and reduces the big "chips" and chunks of bean that blade grinders can create. So if you don't mind a little martini shake action with your grinder for 10-15 seconds, then great!

CONS:
-For $15, very few come to mind, unless you're making espresso or drip that requires a super fine grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: I put coffee grounds into it and get whole beans ...
reviews.reviewText:
I put coffee grounds into it and get whole beans. Wait, the opposite of that.

I have to grind it longer than I thought I would for my French Press. I had read 8 seconds for a FP but in reality I need to grind it for 10-12 seconds. That is an extra 2-4 seconds of my life every day that I'll never get back, but, we will let it slide this time.

If you want to grind coffee beans into ground coffee beans, this is the product for you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dumb place to ask questions but
reviews.reviewText: I have a question. Why does the Amazon page advertising say it's ok to grind beans and spices and other stuff when the literature that came with the grinder says to use for coffee only? I've only used it once and I thought it did fine. Is the use to grind other stuff going to make the beans taste contaminated so to speak? Has anyone who owns one used it for nuts and seeds and spices and then coffee found that it tastes "off"?

I love that this grinder is on the larger size so that I have option with how much I grind at one time. That is really the selling feature for me with this item. It would be nice to have settings or guidelines so I can more precisely grind the coffee for what I want (french press vs. cold brew vs. espresso vs. drip, etc.) but I think the capacity makes up for me having to just get better at figuring out how long to grind for.

reviews.reviewTitle: No worries if eyes aren't fully open yet
reviews.reviewText: I love fresh ground coffee. It can be a hassle to have to remember to grind your beans in the store' which then are no longer fresh ground by the time you get to the bottom of the bag. I have had a hand grinder for quite some time which was very serviceable and got the job done,but grinds very coursely and required running through several cycles of grinding. As long as i remembered to grind my beans the night before, all was great. If I have to try to put all the coodination together in the morning tho? This little friend has simplified my life. I can put my beans in and push the button. A few seconds later I am ready to brew. It is much easier to decide what grind I want also as I have more control, a couple seconds more or less adjusts the grind. Now I can get my coffee first thing in the morning without worry of if I can get both eyes open AND make my body function. Coffee has health benefits that have been determined to extend your life, these are greater if the coffee is freshly ground! Yay! longer life means more coffee drank.

I admit that I am not a coffee drinker, but I have a coworker who lives off of it and she really likes to try all different kinds. This littleVremi Blade Coffee Grinder Electric - For Coffee Bean or Spices with Stainless Steel Blade - Makes 12 to 14 Cups of Pour Over Espresso or Drip Coffee - Instant Travel Grinder with Brush Cleaner - Redis pretty freaking awesome. She showed me how it works, and now I want one, and I don't even drink coffee. This one simple tool is electric, easy to use and makes up to 12-14 cups of coffee. BAM! That is seriously awesome!

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY! The plastic configuration of this grinder ...
reviews.reviewText: DO NOT BUY! The plastic configuration of this grinder promotes inefficient coffee grinding. My Vremi is now in the trash after it would no longer stop grinding (unless I pulled the plug), and I have only had it for three weeks now, using it every other day. The coffee grinds get into the tiny area, a 1/16" plastic dot, that the lid and plastic button on the top presses down into when you power on the grind, and even with multiple cleanings, I was not able to prevent the apparatus from getting stuck. In short, I could not stop it from grinding. This unit is cheaply made, does not hold more than six TBs of coffee grind, and the plastic top is now broken from my attempts to press down on it repeatedly to stop the grinding. DO NOT BUY!

reviews.reviewTitle: Quiet, easy to use, great for herbs, spices, and seeds!
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little electric grinder. I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet it is! I have used this to grind herbs and seeds. Just a few quick pulses and the rosemary from my herb garden is perfect for cooking. You can definitely pulse more if you like them completely ground. I have also ground chia and flax seeds for cooking as well. The included brush is great for getting everything out of the little nooks by the blade. Vremi always has some witty packaging but you may need to exercise some caution with this one. ;)

I have to admit that I am not a coffee drinker. There are many times that I wish I drank coffee. My mother in law, however, is a big coffee drinker. We purchased this Electric Coffee Grinder to use as a travel grinder to bring back and forth to her house to ours. She comes to our house typically for 1 week a month. This has been an amazing tool for her to have to grind her coffee grounds and get the same coffee she has at home.
This would be amazing to take with you anywhere you travel.
My mother in law raves about this grinder and it even comes with a cleaning brush!
She said it was one of the best gifts she has ever received!

This is a great grinder for daily coffee grinding. It has the capacity for about 1-2 pots of coffee depending on how strong you brew your coffee and the capacity of the maker. The blades guide the coffee corse to espresso fine. There aren't alot of buttons which makes it easy to operate. It easily cleans up and is fairly compact to store. I would recommend this for daily family use to have fresh ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor design leads to poor grind
reviews.reviewText:
It's impossible to get an even grind with this grinder.

Every use of this grinder leads to quarter, half, and untouched beans mixed with inconsistent grounds.
The blade of the grinder is too small which makes some of the beans fly around the edges of the container untouched. Because of this, you have to do multiple runs to grind all the beans and eventually you end up with an uneven mixture of fine, semi-fine, and coarse grounds.

This is a very cheap grinder, but I would spend a little more money for something better unless you like muddy coffee

reviews.reviewText: This is a great little coffee grinder. My old one just stopped working and I was looking for a new one. It works quickly, is quieter than most coffee grinders, and is easy to use. I like the rubber material on the outside it makes it easy to grip/hold and helps it stay put on the counter. The coffee grinds evenly and my coffee turned out great. For cleaning it was super easy, the directions say to use a damp cloth to clean the inside. I quickly used a little soap and rinsed quickly and it was fine. I highly recommend this coffee grinder.

It seems to grind beans well enough I do have to give it a shake to redistribute, but that is not such a big deal. It isn't overly noisy, my dog didn't flinch when I turned it on. So other than it's larger circumference I like it very much. I've been using another brand for about 6 months and HATED it. Noisy, messy, impossible to clean properly or pour the ground coffee into my basket for brewing. I had a Braun grinder for get this,18 years. It worked every day sometimes two or three times a day and other than a couple of blade replacements in all those years, never let me down. Until last year when it began to sound like a 747 at take off. RIP

This is a wonderful coffee grinder. I like the textured coral/red silicone grips and chrome-like accents. You simply add your beans, put the lid on, and press down. You control how fine or coarse you desire the beans to be. The coarser grind is definitely better for cold brew. This has a small footprint and is easy to store or display if you prefer. You'll love the aroma of your freshly ground coffee! I highly recommend this coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: design all are very nice, but the only purpose it's designed to do--blending and it cant do a good job
reviews.reviewText: The color, design all are very nice, but the only purpose it's designed to do--blending, it doesn't do that well. The blended ground coffee is coarse and not to the fine ground level. No matter how long I press the button, that's about the degree of grinding it can do. I end up needing to take the entire bag into the store to grind it to finer ground. It gets hot when you try to grind to finer level, as a result it burns the coffee ground and destroys the taste.

I wanted a simple to use, inexpensive coffee bean grinder and this one has fit the bill. I like that it holds a good amount of beans and I just need to press the one button to get started. I prefer a medium grind and I've been able to achieve that with this easily. I haven't used it for anything but I could see myself using it to grind up nuts and spices for baking.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not the machine for a fine grind
reviews.reviewText: It works, but not what I'm looking for. I was looking to get a fine, espresso type grind and this one does not. The grounds were always uneven and I could never get the fine grind. I ended up throwing it away as I got more irritated with grinds all over my country without the payout of the ground I was looking to get.

It grinds very well, the button and spring may come flying apart at the slightest drop of the lid. Can be put back together but is super annoying. The cord also kinda gets caught underneath so its harder than it should be to stand it flush. For those who think it's hard to clean...use a damp paper towel folks.

reviews.reviewTitle: I was really disappointed in this product
reviews.reviewText: I was really disappointed in this product! I had high hopes, but it does not preform well and does not grind coffee as finely as I needed. I would not recommend this grinder if you want a good quality coffee grinder. Unfortunately I didn't use it right away and now I am stuck with it, I will probably just put it in a yard sale or donate.

I've had several grinders over the years and this is one of the best. I've had it now for a little over 6 months and use it almost every day. I haven't had any trouble with it and it is easy to clean. Most grinders I've owned were dead of dying at this point so Vremi Blade Coffee Grinder you get 5 stars.

I am in love with this little coffee grinder! What is better than fresh ground coffee beans for your coffee every single morning? NOTHING! Plus it's cheaper than stopping at the corner coffee shop. It's the perfect match for my small coffee pot besides the fact it's quick and easy to use, easy to clean and beats the heck out of using a hand grinder.

This coffee grinder does a great job every time. Easy to use and looks great on my counter top. I originally purchased this just to grind beans for cold brew but once my husband smelled the aroma we are grinding beans for all our coffee indulgences. Takes 2 mimutes and the flavor of fresh ground coffee can not be duplicated!

This grinder is fantastic! Its easy to clean and works well. I'm especially happy with the rubber outer of the container. It makes it easy to hold while adjusting the lid. I grind my beans every morning and am so pleased with the functionality! Its so easy to use and my kids even enjoy grinding the beans for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: like it was designed for a different grinder
reviews.reviewText: It does grind well. But the top is difficult to fit at times, like it was designed for a different grinder. Also, the cord storing thing on the bottom is poorly designed. It doesn't fit the whole cord. I gave up, and I just let the cord hang out.

This is a very easy to use good quality grinder. Not only can it grind up coffee beans but you can also use it for seeds and spices. Comes with a Manuel and little brush to helps you clean the inside. Very satisfied. Might get a few more to give as gifts this holiday season. Usually grinders are pretty loud but this one not so much. The packaging is just so cute as usual. Vremi products have cute little sayings on the box. I just love it.
Slow and inconsistent grind. I wasnt expecting a burr style grind but you can barely put enough in for one serving at a time. By the time you get rid of all the big chunks most of it is just powder.

Fun, bright color as well a functional. Great for grinding up some fresh coffee! You can adjust how course or fine you grind it. I love using mine for
making iced coffee as well. Also works great as a spice grinder! Cute, secure packaging.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this coffee grinder my last coffee grinder was much ...
reviews.reviewText: Love this coffee grinder my last coffee grinder was much noisier, love the little brush that came with it, would have given it a five star but would have like to have the ability to grind more beanbag once.

Easy to grip, non skid bright red. Pour in the beans, push the button, grinds & done. Easy as that.
Extremely quiet coffee bean grinder!

Not much of a coffee drinker but I had other plans in mind for this.
I use it to make bread crumbs instead of buying them.
Easily grinds up my herbs and stale bread so I don't have to buy the "Italian bread crumbs".

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for grinding spices or coffee
reviews.reviewText: I needed a separate grinder for spices and this product fits the bill. I like to use fresh spices when cooking and I can make my own spice blends easily with this grinder. It is easy to use and easy to clean. It comes with its own brush. I am happy with this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is not that bulky in the inside it works great for because I'm the only one at home who ...
reviews.reviewText: Is not that bulky in the inside it works great for because I'm the only one at home who drinks coffee if you are planning to use it for more than 3 people better look for a different one who could hold more at once!
I use this product twice daily for grind whole fresh flax seeds for my Budwig therapy. Does the job and is a good size to leave out on the counter top without compromising prep space

My old coffee grinder finally gave out. This one seems to work adequately. Need to really grind the beans a long time to get them consistent. Doesn't work as well as the old one, but the price was reasonable.

I was so pleasantly surprised at how quiet the grinder was and how evenly it ground my coffee. The base is easy to grip and has a good solid feel to it. I would recommend to my family and friends. Definitely a good purchase.
Love this sturdy product, very easy and fast to make many different grinds of whole bean coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: You have to hold down the button for 30 to 45 seconds in order to have a chance at getting fine powder from coffee beans
reviews.reviewText:
Gets the job done but not very powerful. You have to hold down the button for 30 to 45 seconds in order to have a chance at getting fine powder from coffee beans.

I always worry that it may overheat. Aesthetically it could look more upscale.

This is a great coffee grinder. It works very well, is very easy and comfortable to hold due to the silicon outer layer. It's easy to clean since it comes with a little brush to get the coffee grounds out. It is also very quiet as far as coffee grinders go.
I like the rubber coating as it makes it easier to shake the grinder while blending. I use it for flax and spices and it cleans up easily.

reviews.reviewTitle: We have been using many of their products and again are impressed with not only awesome, friendly packaging but GREAT QUALITY PRODUCTS
reviews.reviewText: Once again Vremi for the win! We have been using many of their products and again are impressed with not only awesome, friendly packaging but GREAT QUALITY PRODUCTS. It also came with a complimentary brush for cleaning. Loving this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Designed to Make My Husband Happy
reviews.reviewText: We had a Krups brand grinder before I ordered this and my husband finds the Vremi far superier. Its wide, easy to hold base makes it stable. Its shockingly quiet. My husband has sensitive hearing so its wonderful not to see my husband hold his ears while he's making coffee. The deep and wide grinding compartment makes it easy to get the coffee in and out of the appliance without spillage. I was so used to finding a few whole coffee beans on the floor, I didn't realize I should even look for that. A well designed appliance!
I love the color, the design, and the fact that it's the perfect size for my kitchen counter. It does take more than 15 seconds to grind the coffee and the grind is not as fine as I would have hoped.

reviews.reviewTitle: every day - I like to buy the whole beans from SB and then ...
reviews.reviewText: I drink coffee all day, every day - I like to buy the whole beans from SB and then take them home so it always tastes more fresh (to me). This grinder is so easy to use and small enough to keep on the counter beside my coffee pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fell apart on the first use
reviews.reviewText: The button fell apart on the first use. The motor isn't very strong, doesn't do a fantastic job but does get the job done. I would not buy this again and I'm currently looking for a better quality want. I may have just got a bad one but I am not impressed.
We're use this nearly daily. Grinds very well for our coffee. I do find the width of the cup a little large. Not enough to decrease my rating of the product.
Grinder does not grind coffee well. Not fine enough. Lots of larger pieces. Disappointed. I use a French Press so perhaps the coarser grind is for some other method of making coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Unstable and the cord doesn't winds up in the base.
reviews.reviewText: Poor design workmanship. It doesn't grind well and it is unstable. Biggest complain - the cord doesn't winds up in the base.
I've been making a few batches of cold brew and this coffee grinder works really well

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee bean grinder is great for modem coffee
reviews.reviewText: This coffee bean grinder is great for modem coffee, but terrible for espresso. The grinds will not get fine enough, even if you grind for 20s as recommended. But otherwise, it's good.
It is easy to use and empties well. It leaves too many beans partially ground. At least it is red...

reviews.reviewTitle: Im sure there are better grinders out there
reviews.reviewText: Have to grind up small amounts at a time, grind for 5 seconds, stir, grind again for 5 seconds, stir. Yes they grind in 15 seconds but if you dont break that up and stir you end up with with big chunks not ground up. Im sure there are better grinders out there.

This does bring coffee beans ok, but it does not grind them anywhere close to fine, just real course no matter how long you hold the button in or repeat. It will ok until I can get a better more expensive grinder.
Good coffee grinder. It works well and seems like good quality. I like that you can make it more coarse or less coarse depending on the type of coffee you desire.

I don't use this for coffee, but for grinding golden flax seed for recipes. I have also used it to grind erythritol granules (a low carb sugar substitute) into powdered erythritol. It works great! Well worth the money. :)
Much larger capacity than my usual coffee grinder. 2 bowls is more than enough to fill my cold brew pitcher. Very quiet operation as well and sleek modern design doesn't hurt.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have been looking for a simple and easy coffee grinder and stumbled upon a winner
reviews.reviewText: Beans to smithhereens! I have been looking for a simple and easy coffee grinder and stumbled upon a winner. Place your desired amount of beans in and pulse for about 10 seconds and you have a fairly decent ground bean. You can do more pulsing for desired texture but be sure not to hold the button down for too long per directions. It also came with a little brush to help remove any leftovers and clean the reservoir better. I am definitely happy with the product and would recommend to all coffee lovers!

reviews.reviewTitle: Everyone should own a coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: The grinder has a smooth touch to the outside. Good size, easy to clean. The cord for the grinding is around 30" which is nice. Doesn't take up a lot of room for storing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great and the price is unbeatable
reviews.reviewText: Works great and the price is unbeatable. This grinder is good if you are using a coffee maker because it's grind is coarse. If you like a french press or some other method for making your coffee a grinder that grinds more finely might be a better choice.
Cute and Powerful. I've had a lot of coffee grinders over the years. I love this one. I like the nubby grips and the powerful motor.
Used once. Not thrilled with the mess vs the results. It's great for the price and what it does. It's not me.
Works great every morning grinding coffee beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well, quality is a little lower than expected

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds that coffee like a pro barrista!

I can make cinnamon that tastes extremely fresh. Also, going along with their 'cool' vibe, this Vremi product looks so stylish that I haven't taken it off my counter since it arrived. I love that it's bright red and that the nubs on the outside make it easy to handle. Definitely recommend!
Got as a present for my brother and he loves it. Says it works well and the whole-bean coffee I got him was gone very quickly!

After 15 seconds of grinding a couple tablespoons of beans, I still have chunks of beans mixed with ground coffee (for French press). Only gave it three stars because I got what I paid for.

The pros: Lightweight and stylish.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quiet and does what it is intended to do

Now I can purchase my coffee grinds wholesale and save money. Also works well with grinding fresh spices and making your own powdered sugar.

title: Vremi Electric Coffee Grinder - 150 Watt Portable Coffee Bean Grinder with Easy Touch Settings Stainless Steel Blades - Grinds Coarse Fine Ground Beans for 12 to 14 Cups of Coffees - Red
features:
Make sure this fits
                by entering your model number.

INSTANT ELECTRIC COFFEE GRINDER - Our electric coffee grinder is designed with an easy one-touch control that allows for a continuous grind. Simply place your coffee beans in the grinder, place the lid on top and press the button. In just a few seconds you'll have fresh grounds right at your fingertips

WITH DOUBLE STAINLESS STEEL BLADES - Features sharp and durable double stainless steel blades that grind with precision from whole to coarse to fine ground beans for making french press coffees, espresso or just your regular cup of joe. Note: Do NOT use to grind other types of food

LARGE CAPACITY GRINDER with SAFETY LID - This quiet compact coffee maker with rubber grip exterior has a 100g capacity for coffee beans, enough for 12 to 14 cups of coffee. It also features a removable safety lock lid for quick and safe use. This makes it great for travel or as a housewarming gift

HASSLE FREE GRINDING EXPERIENCE - This small home kitchen coffee grinder machine is equipped with anti-slip feet for added stability, a convenient cord storage and a high power 150W (25000-28000 R/MIN) low noise motor making sure your family sleeps peacefully while you prepare their morning cup

PORTABLE COFFEE GRINDERS with BRUSH CLEANER -This grinder measures 7.5 x 4 x 3.5 inches in classic black and red. No disassembly required to clean the mini grinder, just use the included cleaning brush in a kit to clean (NOTE: always UNPLUG appliance before cleaning)

qAndA.question: How come the description says "for coffee bean or spices", and the instructions say, "do not use for spices!!!??
qAndA.answer: Yep, coffee and some herbs really have a way of infusing things with their smell and taste. I won't even let a roommate put flavored beans in my grinder, let alone herbs! It's best to have separate grinders if you care about the taste of your coffee... I would think that most people buying a grinder care.

qAndA.answer: You put your coffee beans in and push down on top . That is all it takes to get perfect ground coffee! Highly recommend!
